ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Please select your top two most heavily used substances aside from your primary substance - Heroin or other Opiates (e.g., prescription opioids like Percocet, oxycontin; Morphine, etc.)
Notes: 0=Not selected; 1=Selected

ElementDescription: Please select your top two most heavily used substances aside from your primary substance - Benzos (Valium, Xanax, etc.)
Notes: 0=Not selected; 1=Selected

ElementDescription: Please select your top two most heavily used substances aside from your primary substance - Nicotine
Notes: 0=Not selected; 1=Selected

ElementDescription: Please select your top two most heavily used substances aside from your primary substance - Prescription stimulants (Adderall, Ritalin)
Notes: 0=Not selected; 1=Selected

ElementDescription: Please select your top two most heavily used substances aside from your primary substance - Cocaine, amphetamine, methamphetamine
Notes: 0=Not selected; 1=Selected

ElementDescription: Please select your top two most heavily used substances aside from your primary substance - Other type of substance than those listed
Notes: 0=Not selected; 1=Selected

ElementDescription: Please select your top two most heavily used substances aside from your primary substance - Other type of substance than those listed, specify.
Indicate where on the ladder you are in regards to your current thoughts and feelings about your primary substance.
Notes: 1=I enjoy using my primary substance and have decided I''ll never change it. I have no interest in changing the way I use my primary substance; 2=I never think about changing the way I use my primary substance, and I have no plans to change; 3=I rarely think about changing the way I use my primary substance, and I have no plans to change it; 4=I sometimes think about changing the way I use my primary substance, but I have no plans to change it; 5=I often think about changing my use of my primary substance, but I have no plans to change it; 6=I definitely plan to change my use of my primary substance, but I''m not ready to make any plans about how to change; 7=I definitely plan to change my use of my primary substance, and I''m almost ready to make some plans about how to change; 8=I plan on using my primary substance. But I''ll make some changes, like cutting back on the amount of my primary substance I use; 9=I have changed my use of my primary substance, but I still worry about slipping back so I need to keep working on the changes I''ve made; 10=I have changed my use of my primary substance and will never go back to the way I used my primary substance before

ElementDescription: What is your primary substance or drug of choice for which you are seeing a treatment provider?
Notes: 1=None; 2=Marijuana; 3=Alcohol; 4=Downers or Sedatives (Barbiturates, etc.); 5=Heroin or other Opiates (e.g., prescription opioids like Percocet, oxycontin; Morphine, etc.); 6=Benzos (Valium, Xanax, etc.); 7=Nicotine; 8=Prescription stimulants (Adderall, Ritalin); 9=Cocaine, amphetamine, methamphetamine; 10=Other type of substance than those listed

ElementDescription: What is your primary substance or drug of choice for which you are seeing a treatment provider? Specify other:
Aside from the primary substance, do you have any other substances for which you are seeing a treatment provider?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

Notes: 0=Not selected; 1=Selected

ElementDescription: Please select your top two most heavily used substances aside from your primary substance - Downers or Sedatives (Barbiturates, etc.)
Notes: 0=Not selected; 1=Selected

ElementDescription: Each rung of this ladder represents where a person might be in thinking about changing their drinking.  What is the NUMBER ON THE LADDER that best represents where you are now? (Cada n?mero en esta escala representa donde est? la persona con respecto a estar pensando sobre cambiar sus h?bitos de bebida.)
Notes: 0 = No thought of changing (Ninguna intenci?n de cambiar); 1; 2 = Think I need to consider changing someday (Pensando que necesito considerar cambiar alg?n d?a); 3; 4; 5 = Think I should change, but not quite ready (Pensando que debo cambiar, pero no estoy del todo listo); 6; 7; 8 = Starting to think about how to change my drinking patterns (Empezando a pens sobre c?mo camber mis h?bitos de bebida); 9; 10 = Taking action to change (e.g., cutting down) (Tomando medidas para cambiar (ej. restringiendo el consumo))

ElementDescription: The following questionnaire is designed to identify how you personally feel about your drinking right now.
Notes: 1=I don''t think I drink too much; 2=I am trying to drink less than I used to; 3=I enjoy my drinking, but sometimes I drink too much; 4=Sometimes I think I should cut down on my drinking; 5=It''s a waste of time thinking about my drinking; 6=I just recently changed my drinking habits; 7=Anyone can talk about wanting to do something about drinking, but I am actually doing something about it; 8=I am at the stage where I should think about drinking alcohol; 9=My drinking is a problem sometimes; 10=There is no need for me to think about changing my drinking; 11=I am actually changing my drinking habits (i.e.,  to drink less) right now; 12=Drinking less alcohol would be pointless for me

ElementDescription: How do you feel about changing your current drinking right now?
Notes: 0= I never think about drinking less; 2= Sometimes I think about drinking less; 4= I have decided to drink less; 6= I am already trying to cut back on my drinking

ElementDescription: On a scale from 0 to 10, how ready are you right now to reduce or stop your drinking?
Notes: 0= Not ready; 10= Ready

ElementDescription: Which statement best indicates where you are right now in thinking about drinking?
Notes: 1= Not ready to reduce or stop; 2= Not sure; 3= Thinking about reducing or stopping; 4= Plan to reduce or stop in the next month; 5= Already reduced or stopped

ElementDescription: RIGHT NOW, how important is it to you to cut down or quit using alcohol?
Notes: 1=Not at all important; 10=Very important

ElementDescription: RIGHT NOW, how ready are you to cut down or quit using alcohol?
Notes: 1=Not at all ready; 10=Very ready

ElementDescription: In the NEXT 2 MONTHS, how much do you want help for your alcohol use?
Notes: 1=No help wanted; 10=Very much want help

ElementDescription: In the NEXT 2 MONTHS, how confident are you that you could reduce your alcohol use if you wanted to?
Notes: 1=Not confident at all; 10=Very confident

ElementDescription: In the NEXT 2 MONTHS, how confident are you that you will reduce your alcohol use?
Notes: 1=Not confident at all; 10=Very confident
